of all the places in the Mission, Bobby Flay chose this place?
author: c c.

description: Came here to try the burritto dish after it was featured on Food Networks "Throwdown with Bobby Flay". My feeling is that it's an exceptable dish compared to a lot of burritto joints out there. Sauce, salsa and guacamole is very tasty which really adds to it.  Haven't been here enough to really critique the other items. Gets crowded at times. Check it out!!!
author: Tom W.

description: You know, one day Papalote will be my go-to place for Mexican food. I imagine myself, ten years from now, stroller in both hands, blackberry neuro-phone firmly embedded in the deep recesses of my skull (go technology!), walking in to Papalote and ordering up some good, clean, relatively expensive Mexican food. They will be really nice to my kids and know my name, because Papalote is that kind of place. I might even have a "usual" order which will be cool, giving me a real sense of community, which is hard to find in the 2010s, what with everything being owned by Google. Although it will appear that I have it all, I will lament those days, decades prior, when I was able to freely descend down 24th to Mission and further to get a burrito. A time when I cared less about my meat intake, kids-friendly menus, or atmosphere, and more about eating where the best food is. That will be really awesome - the blackberry implanted in my brain, that is.
author: Brian H.

description: the best burrito in san francisco hands down. definitely not your typical mission taqueria and that's why it's awesome. lots of veggie options, killer hot sauce and guacamole, and they never ever  mess up your order. if you just drop in and order you'll have to wait a while for your food, so is best to call ahead or eat in!
author: Amy P.

description: While I greatly respect their use of organic tofu, which is hard to find at the mom-n-pop shops, I have to say that I always feel a little sleazy using this soulless venue rather than any of the traditional taquerias surrounding it. Let's hope it doesn't run anyone out of business.
author: Geae D.

description: before i went to visit san francisco for the first time, i got exactly one food rec-- papalote in the mission.  before i went i even messaged one of the owners on myspace because that's how thorough i am.  and you know what?  everyone on here is correct!  the ingredients were super-fresh.  and they have the best salsa this side of the rio grande.  just thinking about those burritos makes me wish i didn't live so far away...
author: Aimee C.

description: while i was blissfully enjoying my soyrizo, guacamole and tofu mole burrito, i blurted out, "five stars" in between moans of pleasure.  a friend i was with asked me, "are you always such a positive yelp reviewer?" to which i laughed because i've had a few people comment on my superfluous 1 and 2 star reviews (which, i think, is not a reflection of my own negativity but a product of south orange county living).  the salsa was AMAZING!  and creamy and delicious.  even the pickled jicama spiced with chile was delicious.  the prices are even decent and if i hadn't decided to fix it up so much it would have been under $5.  of course, with all my fixin's it ended up being $8.  still not terrible for a big burrito with plenty of heart and soul.  i was full enough to be happy the entire hour and a half that bryan and i spent walking around the mission looking for our lost car.
author: Laura V.

description: good, healthy, quick. the only thing that bugged me was that they were pretty stingy with the chips for our 10 person $150 order even when i asked for more.
author: lisa w.

description: Papalote, I really do love you.  I am basically a yuppie, and I love how you cater to my yuppie tastes with tofu and soyrizo and various veggies options.  Although, I really do not like the grilled veggie, how can eggplant and zucchini, such delicious vegetables, taste so bitter?  Yuck.  The fish tacos, however, are delicious and light, and in my mind, a major food group since I eat them all the time.  My only complaint though is that when people order a jar of salsa, please give it to them, don't make them walk back to the store later that night or the next day because you forgot it once again, especially when they are in a taco haze, and can't be responsible for remembering things like whether or not they got a to-go jar.  Thank you very much.
author: Jessica T.

description: I never hit a chance to try the food because the server was so incredibly rude that I asked to be refunded my money and left -something I have never done before!  I don't like throw words like homophobic around, so, u decide.  My masculine looking female partner and I sit down at a 3 top in the back to avoid sitting at the open 2 top with a line of people right besides it. If I'm paying $8 for a burrito I don't want to eat it with people standing at my table... There are 10 or so open seats but the server doesn't want two people to sit at a 3. She asks asks us to move. We realize again that the line is at the table abs go back. There are plenty of open seats for guests of 3 or more. Then she returns and asks me to move to the other chair at our table do she can at least make the other table next to us for three people. I do. She then turns the chair I was sitting in around to the table next to us. That table was occupied by one masculine looking man. So. She didn't want two people at a three person table she wanted one person at it?  I've been a server for combined over 7 years. Her actions made no sense. My partner was hungry n made her burrito to go. As we waited for it one fem woman sat at the other table in back and out table was then taken by a single masculine man... Neither were asked to move...
author: Happy R.

description: Prices have gone up a bit here and the wait can be long since the food is cooked per order, but the food is excellent. So many veggie options and the staff seem like they really want you to be there. Been coming here for years and love that you can call ahead for take out. My favorites are the fish tacos, tofu quesidilla, and the grilled veggie burrito.
author: M C.

description: papalote! i think i want to rename this place yummylote. i love how they have so many vegetarian options. i had their potato/tomato quesadilla, and i have never tasted something so good. imagine being drunk, starving, and then biting into the perfect mix of cheese, tortilla, and potato. worth the wait in line!
author: Oleya P.

description: located on the noe/mission border, this taqueria is definitely fancier than the others on 24th. you can tell by the numerous veggie options available on the menu (soyrizo, marinated tofu) as well as the shrimp/fish sauteed in white wine and butter. i forgot what we ordered here, so that probably tells you something. it was decent but nothing outstanding...except for the house-made salsa.
author: Angi C.

description: Can't stand the place. Among the least friendly service I have ever experienced. And have a look at their safety inspection score. It's a very frightening 70 (Dec 08). Stay away.
author: Victoria A.

description: frtesh, fresh, fresh....i will go to el farolito at 2 am when i am drunk and it'll be greasy and great. but the rest of the time and when i am sober, papalote is the spot! always tastes fresh, tasty and i never feel gross or guilty after i eat b/c it is so not greasy here. if you are craving grease, try the chorizo & cheese....slap your moma good. i go with chicken or shrimp...tacos or burrito. everything is good here. and they always have good fliers to peek at while you are waiting for takeout. fast, good, nice people working here, clean, bottled coke...yum, great food.
author: kelly M.

description:
pros: good salsa, and (apparently) good for vegans

cons: weak service, surly attitudes from staff, long wait for food, incorrect orders (while denying they made a mistake), small portions (including salsa), mediocre food, and (did I mention?) weak service.

recommendation: most other mexican food joints are better.
author: Tim T.

description: Ordered take-out burritos - along with extra salsa - from the Mission location.  The veggie burritos with potato and mushrooms were delicious - they kindly added chunks of avocado (which was ordered for the arroz y frijoles burrito but even better with the veggies!).  The shrimp super was excellent.  Everything was fresh and made-to-order.  No choice of salsa but the house version is amazing - blended rather than chunky but very tasty and spicy.  Definitely worth the visit and a return trip!
author: Cecilia B.

description: mutiple vegan options in a burrito joint? yes, please! it's not my favorite place to get a burrito, but i really like that there are vegan options on the menu and you don't have to play fifty questions when ordering.
author: karen w.

description: A good burrito, nice light taste. I might have given this place five stars but I just got back from El Metate, so I've learned that I can expect to hold Mission taquerias to extraordinary standards. Still, quite good, and the salsa is particularly excellent.
author: Frank T.

description: I have eaten at this restaurant since it opened. Last night 6 of us walked in together. They would only serve 4 of us citing the fact that only take out was now available. The treatment was rude. They would not refund my money so I could leave with my friends who they would not seat and would only acknowledge our confusion and ultimately anger with shrugs and vague dismissal. I liked this restaurant and have talked it up on many many occasions over the years, but never ever ever again. I'd rather get my salsa from a jar.
author: Honey J.

description: i was torn about making this a 5 star place but the fact they slightly messed up the wife's order brought them down to a 4.  that aside, the burrito here is the best i've had in the city.  it topples la corneta as the king for me.  my baseline burrito at each new joint, is a carne asada super burrito with no rice and no sour cream and this was an absolute knockout here.  i loved that fact that they had refried black beans so that kicked up the flavor big time!  and i'd be remiss by not mention their salsa here.  holy moly this is good!  i was slathering this stuff on chips and everything edible.  it's very smoky and almost has a very tandoori type of flavor!  i can't wait to go back and try out some camarones :-)
author: Swarup B.

description: yummy salsa, great chips, and the brothers will make you smile.
author: Sheridan P.

description: A friend of mine lives around the corner from this place, and I am so glad she turned me on to Papalote.  It is certainly American-ized, but I'm okay with that.  Both times I've had a grilled chicken burrito, and both times I have thoroughly enjoyed my meal and left completely stuffed.  I like their system, where you walk in and order, then take a number and sit at a table.  They have a small selection of agua frescas as well as sodas and Mexican beer.  The staff is super quick at bringing chips and salsa to your table so you don't sit there starving.  Their salsa really is amazing.  I have no idea what they do to it, but it is the perfect amount of spiciness for me, and I love the smokiness of the chilies in there.  I usually pour more of the salsa onto my burrito, which is so huge I eat it with a knife and fork.  I have yet to order them, but the nachos look amazing.  Definitely a two-person order, they look like a huge mound of cheesy deliciousness.  When I'm in the area, this is my spot for a burrito.
author: Lindsay B.

description: I don't live here anymore, but when I return to the Bay Area, it is imperative that I eat the chilaquiles. Papalote makes the best salsa I have ever had. Period.  Also, the first time I came in there when they had just opened I was hungover and wanted some milk. They didn't have any and ran out and bought some for me. I thought that was nice. Heh.
author: Mary G.

description: I am a Mexican food snob and this place is one of the better locations in SF.  The burritos are tasty and clean.  The chips are good and there is seating.  This is one of my regular take-out joints
author: Matt J.

description: so it's not authentic... so what!?  i loved their salsa, and their quesadillas (the zucchini one), nachos and tacos were all delish!  my only qualm was their rushing us (even though it was understandable due to the saturday night rush.)
author: Jill k.

description: chile verde burrito. super. refried beans. really bland. really wet inside. everything was in one place. there was a blob of guacamole at one point in the burrito. a blob of beans somewhere else. weird. i expected better. it was certainly filling!
author: Wangston P.

description: hands down best salsa i've ever tasted. i dream of slathering this salsa on everything. yes...everything. the only way my review would be better is if they suddenly decided to open a place next door to my house.
author: heather m.

description: right down the street from my house but i frequent it not because of the close proximity but because of the chow. amazing fish tacos, slammin salsa that you just want to slurp up and healthy choices for the vegans and veggiemites in your life. faves-- mushroom burrito con grilled tofu, groovy tunes, mission hipsters galore and bike parking in front. bummers-- they could work on their chips and i get a bit grumbley about the 1 bowl of chips per party. the salsa is just to good to limit the dipping.
author: CTP p.

description: def NOT authentic, but its clean and decent.  near my school, so it's pretty cool, but not somewhere i'd specifically go to.
author: Coco C.

description: i could just go to eat the salsa, which is amazing.  they also have soyrizo which is awesome in a quesodilla, probably my favorite burritos in the mission, i wish they were closer to our house they they are. the tables are a little awkwardly packed in, and the line sometimes snakes out the door, perhaps they could expand to 16th....
author: Jared Z.

description: Here are the facts: I walked up to the counter and ordered 1 shrimp burrito. There were 3 people who had already ordered and were standing around waiting for their food. The time recorded on my receipt was 7:04pm. I waited.....and waited....and waited....and waited...then waited some more....one of the people who were waiting at the time I ordered had already eaten their burrito and left! Finally at 7:35pm I received a tiny shrimp burrito. After this long wait I discover the shrimp in the burrito was rubbery and overcooked. I will never come here again..........Plus the bathroom reeks of urine.
author: Tennis F.

description: The salsa is so good that I buy an extra jar every time I go to take home with me!  I love the prawn burrito.  I've tried other burritos -- but I always come back to this one....
author: Sara O.

description: This is my favorite yuppie burrito place - where I can take friends who want to experience the Mission's food without "experiencing" the Mission. Now, don't get me wrong, I love the Mission - I can't imagine living anywhere else - but when I need to take my parents to a taqueria, I take them to Papalote's. I love meat, but I also love their tofu burritos. And... their salsa. This salsa is like crack. I buy jars of this stuff for myself, for friends. It never ceases to amaze me that people keep eating and then have to cut themselves off when there is only a few scoops left. You've been forewarned - don't start this addiction unless you're prepared to be disappointed by all other salsas.
author: J K.

description: oh my can i give it a 6 stars? i am so addicted to this place. i always come here after steph snyder's class at yoga tree valencia. it's pretty much a ritual. the price is unbeatable. 2 tacos for 3 bucks? it's fabulous. basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos. and to super size it, you can add sour cream, cheese and guacamole for 99 cents! woo wee! their grilled veggie tacos are devine. i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste. overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again. also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful. the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area. i will recommend it! also it is close to 24th street mission bart.
author: Cindy L.

description: yum. yum. yum. i only wish the line were a little shorter but for a papalote veggie super burrito, i would wait until the end of time.
author: Joanna M.

description: The fish burrito I had here was delicious. Flaky chunks of white fish were distributed evenly among the rice and black beans. I didn't care for the jicama salad though. It tasted and looked like some kind of awkward mexican kimchee.
author: Crystal L.

description: this is one of my favorite mexican restaurants in san francisco.  the food is really tasty.  they don't use too much or too little sauce.  they bring it out to your table, so the system is pretty efficient.  the chips are the perfect level of saltiness.  plus, my friend, who's a vegetarian, thought it was great because they have a lot of vegetarian options like tofu.  i've been here twice already and it doesn't disappoint!
author: Robyn F.

description:
recently papalote bumped out cancun as my favorite burrito in the city.  it probably helps that it's the most convenient taqueria to me...  but also it's a lot fresher and less greasy than the other taquerias in the area.   as much as i love it, i can't give them 5 stars because of the occasional lapses in greatness.  once in a while something is off - the chicken overcooked, the filling skimpy on the "super" ingredients, or once, there was a disturbing surfeit of beans!  it's still a good burrito, but not always consistent.  

there is usually a long wait, but that's easily avoided by calling in ahead of time.  

i recommend the chicken or rice and bean super burrito.  i'm not a fan of the tofu.
author: wendy p.

description:
love love love this place for take out.  

Burritos are beyond yummy.  Best way to ensure getting out of there within 20 minutes though is to call and place your order over the phone.  Otherwise, get in line baby.  Takes a while to make it to the front and then you have to wait an additional 10 min or so to get your warm pound of happiness.

So worth it though.
author: Kate W.

description: A friend and I made the mistake of going to Papalotes the day after the throwdown with Bobby Flay. There were only 2 or 3 people ahead of us. We arrived at 2:00pm. I place our order to go(by now there was a line of about 25 people behind us): 2 triple threats and a shrimp burrito. I really hadn't looked at the prices, but when the cashier ran up the total to 42.00 I about had a heart attack. I paid it. Then we waited, and waited and waited and waited some more. Finally got our order. It was now 3:00. We had an appointment, so I did not check our order. Enroute to the appointment my friend ate his "shrimp burrito"-oops, in checking the order we in fact got 2 carne asada burritos and one triple threat. Don't know how our original order translated to this...but to be fair we checked the reciept and we paid for what we got. We just did not get what I asked for. Yes, a triple threat is $20.00, but like what has been written about here before,they are the same size as the steak burrito. I will never order the triple threat again. It is really a rip. It tasted good, but not worth the price.
author: C. W.

description: yummy, semi-healthy and nice blue floors...
author: Lisa F.

description: Best in the Mission, hands down. Go for the steak super burrito - you will be converted. Gotta love that house sauce!
author: Eric O.

description: Best burrito hands down. Fresh, tasty. I especially like the rice and bean burrito with black refried beans. I recommend calling ahead to order because the line can be annoying.
author: Jessie H.

description: great vegetarian options- not only tofu but soyrizo too; the nachos were delish. i kind of drive out of my way (all the way from glen park)  to this placewhen i'm craving good quick mexican food, if that tells you anything.
author: ms.kiki g.

description: can i mail-order the salsa to new orleans please?  ... and go ahead and throw in a fish taco while you're at it.
author: Allison M.

description: you can not go wrong here, everything is amazing. we eat here way too often. parking during peak hours can be difficult sometimes.
author: cindy d.

description:
i like that their salsa is different than your usual salsa. it's saucier in every way. 
my friend's fish tacos were very good. they did a great job cooking the fish. i gladly and shamelessly ate the rest of her fish when she was done. i had a chicken burrito. it was good, but i feel burritos are generally good and hard to screw up.
author: Kan L.

description: papalote is one of the only mexican food spots i eat at regularly and enjoy. the veggie burrito is pretty good and the salsa is insane. i love it. being from san diego, i'm really picky about my mexican food...papalote is the best i've found so far.
author: eve l.

description: Maybe I just don't get this place.  The salsa is okay, but the burritos are at the bottom end of the spectrum if you're a carnivore.  If you're a vegeterian, this place might be okay for you assuming you really want tofu or spinach in your burrito (the vegeterian burritos at Cancun have much more flavor, but no vegetables or tofu).  I live around the corner, so I've tried this place a few times just purely out of convenience, but I will always walk the extra 2 blocks to get a more authentic burrito from now on.  There's a reason the only people of color in this place are the ones working behind the counter.
author: Jose W.

description: My favorite Mexican place in the city.  I love that it's clean, that there's always new art up on the walls (though not always suiting my taste), and that their fish tacos are not fried but made with a butter-wine-garlic marinade.  Their salsa is not authentic (I don't think) but it's very delicious.
author: Christina C.

description: Oh frabjous day! Papalote's vegan soyrizo burrito made my March. I had it with black beans on spinach tortilla, and man oh man, what a treat. Their housemade salsa is ticker than tick, and their tortilla chips are really awesome too. Everything seems to be reasonably priced - my burrito was $5.75, and worth every finger-lickin' cent.
author: Sophie K.

description: Always looking for the best burrito (& cheap Mexican food) in town so I went here based on the suggestion of a drunk girl in the Mission one night and favorable Yelp ratings. Sorry, still doesn't unseat Cancun for me. The food was good with fresh/high quality ingredients but it just didn't blow me away, maybe my expectations were too high? Would've easily rated 4 stars except that it was crowded as hell with 20 something Mission hipsters (which I would expect), took well over half an hour to wait in line and actually get food even with really simple orders, so -1 for making me & my friend starve...
author: Trishan A.

description: the burritos are great - and i like the fact that you can get refried beans - which is awesome - also, they have coke in a glass bottle, which is always awesome - unfortunately, the service is pretty awful - you can't get extra salsa upon request (its good but not worth gold) and you cant really get any service except 'can i take your order?' - its also really small and seems dingy considering the price you pay for the food, its not really worth it - but still, if you want a good burrito, this is a good place to check out (get it to go and buy some salsa on the side since they don't give you enough) - like many other places, the quality of the food is overshadowed by the non-existent customer service
author: AARISH P.

description: i am in love with the soyrizo at papalote. whether in a burrito or taco, it's amazingly delicious. their salsa is also divine, but they don't give you enough. the best part about this place is that you don't feel overly fully after finishing a meal.
author: selma s.

description: the best that ever lived...plus my homey Mr.E aka Miguel is probably the coolest cat that ever walked in SF. if you havent had the home made salsa..get you behind to Papalote's!!!!
author: Mwapagha M.

description: Veggie taco and soyrizo taco. Chips and salsa. The veggie taco was bland and the soyrizo taco was over seasoned and small. Salsa was fantastic but not enough to keep me coming.
author: Sarah J.

description:
I lived in the mission for ten years just before I moved to Berkeley. I am originally from Guatemala, but have traveled a lot through Southern Mexico, the Mayan side of Mexico. 
So now that you know what I am not, I will let you know what I like about the place. First, the place is clean. If you care that your food is clean, this is necessary. Second, the food is fresh and not very greasy. It is simple, unassuming, and light. I recommend the fish tacos, and the seasoned tofu is surprisingly good (I usually do not like tofu). It reminds me of tandoori masala because of all the spices used. 
So stay away of this place if:
You like extremely cheap and greasy Mexican food. 
You care a lot about the people around you. Yes, there is definitely less Latin people but this is hardly the only place that has less Latin people on this side of the Mission. If you want to see Latin people stick to the ones by the Mission and to the East of it. 
But if you are just a normal person looking for a clean and different taqueria, I recommend it. If you read the other reviews they focus on political and ethnic stuff, which I think is ridiculous when you are reviewing food.
author: Joseph B.

description: Fish tacos were SOOOOOOOO good. They give you chips and salsa too with your order! Completely affordable and plentiful. Everything seemed so fresh and was very well-seasoned as well. Definitely a return place for me!!!
author: E M.

description: Freaking delicious.  The only complaint I have is the stinginess on salsa, as it's what makes the food what it is there.
author: Rajen S.

description: I went here because it was on the way to where i was going and and it had good reciews. I wish i hadn't. Regular burrito $7.50. I got cheese which brought it up to $9.30. $1.50 extra? Guacamole is even more. Then I waited close to ten minutes, and it wasn't busy at all. So it's twice as expensive and takes more than twice as long as any number of place within a couple blocks. This is real BS. I've had time to make a phone call, log on to Yelp to write this review up to here, and still no food. Still waiting... And here it is, now 15 minutes after ordering. How is it? Not so good. Pretty bland and dry, heavy on the rice. I got chicken and it's dry and bland also. And they didn't put on the cheese. I'd been here before with similar results but gave it another chance because of convenience and good reviews. I could have walked down to La Cornetta or, even better, La Tacqeria, and had my food faster and it would have been tasty and reasonably priced. I just don't understand the good reviews.
author: Matthew T.

description: Wonderful burritos.  Chile verde is incredible.  I buy a jar of the salsa weekly to use at home too.
author: Amy F.

description: This place has been on my mind a lot lately. They put somethin' in that salsa i think. I need to go soon so I can check is it really as good as I remember.
author: Miss L.

description: Great place, I love the one on 24th street better than the one on Fulton for the simple reason it has better seating arrangement. Love salsa that comes with chips. Tofu burrito, Vegan burrito are fantastic. Love this place and prices are very very cheap.
author: Kingshuk g.

description: Attention vegetarians: Yummy, yummy tofu burritos here.  I like the tofu mole, my friend likes the marinated tofu.  We fight about which is better, but really, they're both quite good.
author: Rosie R.

description: my favorite burrito.  the super fish burrito is amazing, and the super chicken is also very good.  while i have never personally experienced it, i have heard underwhelming opinions of the burritos from friends and roommates.  when i ask if they got it super, they say "no," which is a fatal mistake.  Always get it SUPER.
author: Pete A.

description: Like a few other  grumpy reviewer here, I was terribly unimpressed with this place.  I wouldn't mind the noisiness or the lines so much if the food had any real value, but by and large it turned out to be worse than the most mediocre of tacquerias in the mission. On my visits *(yes, I gave it two shots) I had two different kinds of burritos.  The first was a carne assada, well stuffed with thinly sliced, overcooked meat, largely tasteless, and combined with a mushy beans and rice.   The second trip was another burrito, this time a Verde, which left an even worse impression:  The pork was watery and overcooked, lacking any pork character, the sauce had an odd medicinal flavor and the beans and rice..well, you get the picture.   The only thing worthwhile was the salsa for the chips, which was both creamy and piquant.    Given the lines of people and the full (and noisy) tables, I wrote down a rule for myself: The quality of a restaurant, around Valencia anyway, is inversely proportional to its popularity (I can think of other overrated and popular mediocrities--Dosa and Beretta spring to mind). Perhaps the food police should close down the street and enforce cooking classes on those young  professionals  that pack places like these, oblivious to fakery and overpricing.
author: Pan K.

description: This place is awesome! and the food is Waaaaayyyy! better then any other Mexican place this side of the border!
author: Daniel H.

description: i was entirely sold by the fact that you can get your burrito with refried BLACK beans.  yum! enough said.
author: Brenna V.

description: even though i live closer to mexico than ever, i still miss my old neighborhood haunt. i love the fish tacos and the pork burrito. the signature salsa is to die for. cool music, great atmosphere. i go back whenever i am in town.
author: kelly f.

description: I know people love Papalote, but for me it's too specific to be on my favorites list.  I have to be in the mood for fusion Mexican and those exact flavors.  That said, I would be really sad if this place didn't exist.  It's great for an every-now-and-then eat, and if I were just rating their salsa, it would be 5 stars.
author: caroll c.

description: The burritos here are head and shoulders above the rest. Cheap, and friendly service too.  Try the chile verde - I would walk miles uphill in the rain for this stuff.
author: A R.

description: huge portions and the salsa is delicious. worth going to mission for
author: hugh k.

description: LOVE the food...HATE the fact that I have to pay for extra salsa!
author: Shabnam A.

description: Papalote probably doesn't need my praise, but I love it so much that I am writing a glowing review any way. It's usually pretty busy in there, and with good reason. The food is just good. I get the veggie burrito and am always happy to find big chunks of fresh veggies in there. Squash, carrots, eggplant, they dont mess around at Papalote. Nothing's too greasy or heavy, and the salsa is really great. Sometimes the ordering area can be a little hectic, but take a deep breath....you're about to get some quality, well-priced Mexican food. Yum.
author: Muffin F.

description: "Super grilled chicken burrito with refried beans and both kinds of salsa" = best burrito in the city.  Call ahead, though, and take it home.
author: M A.

description: Love their salsa--I pick up a jar once a week and score major points at home!!!  Another favorite of mine is their vegetarian mole burrito!  mmm....I'm hungry!
author: christine t.

description: i was expecting a similar experience to the other papalote. learned that expectations are like assholes (and opinions), everyone has 'em, and they stink. this papalote would be perfect IF ONLY they weren't so slow about everything. the comment was made, and to which i agreed, that asking for something actually slows them down even more. but, that minor flaw aside, these guys (and girls) know how to do a fish burrito right. as jessica once told me when i wrote my first review, papalote's fish burritos are something to behold. and, if you are not in san francisco, or have access to this amazing restaurant, you truly are not living life as it was meant to be lived. (ok, that may be a bit much, but you get my point) something about marinating the fish in whatever wine they marinate it in really brings the whole package home. a bit pricey for a burrito (i spent $10.60 something on just the burrito), but occasionally life requires you give a little extra.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: love this place.  portions here are smaller thaan other mexican places in this neighborhood but i think the food here is tastier and healthier.  can be a long wait for food but i dont really mind.  like everyone says, salsa is crack
author: David C.

description: wait 30 minutes for a vegan burrito? that's, like, soooooo san francisco
author: Erica C.

description: Papalote is a healthful change of pace from the usual Mission fare, offering meats not drenched in lipids, refried beans without lard and various vegan ingredients like grilled marinated tofu, mole tofu and soyrizo. The lettuce, tomatoes, cilantro and other auxiliary ingredients are always fresh, and the award-winning house salsa, which is made from scratch every day, is dangerously addictive and worthy of its reputation as the best salsa in the city. Unfortunately the meats -- namely, the chile verde, carne asada and grilled chicken -- tend to be dry and a bit tough, possibly because it appears that the pork, beef and chicken are cooked with virtually all their fat trimmed away; even so, they are well-seasoned and thus quite enjoyable, especially when dispatched in a super burrito, which keeps the moisture level up by way of sour cream, cheese and guacamole. Omnivores not interested in smothering their meats in such heavy condiments may want to steer toward the marinated seafood options: prawns grilled with lime juice, sauteed shrimp and sauteed fish. Papalote may not provide what most would consider traditional Mexican food, but it does offer satisfying, heart-smart innovations in Mexican cuisine.
author: Eugene P.

description: best burrito i've ever had.  i ordered the vegetarian burrito with the refried black beans.  it was so good i almost cried while i was eating it.  i will definitely return.  and maybe i was lucky, but there was no real wait.  i'm annoyed i have to pay for salsa (55 cents, whatever), but it is so good that i don't mind at all.
author: annabel l.

description: only been here twice, but so far this is a three star taqueria. had the chicken mole burrito which was juicy, and flavorful, and took away any doubts i had about mole in a burrito outfit.  the salsa alone is worth a trip, it is creamy with rosted (tomato?) pieces. i found myself going back a few days later, and sampled the chili verde tacos. the meat was a little dry, but a healthy addition of the salsa made the taco perfect. i couldn't tell for sure if the tortillas were fresh, but i would bet that they are. the jicama salad with orange garnish is a fantastic touch on each plate. decent prices as well, and a nice mexican beer selection.
author: Lesley S.

description: Oh man...The salsa for the chips is pretty unique and what I would consider to be more "pasty" than chunky. But it's good and weird in a way so you keep going back to it until your warm, fresh chips are gone. Fear not because your carne asada burrito has arrived with that mango salsa on the side! One savory  cube per perfectly balanced bite, of course. (You can't waste the little gems, which are clearly rare given how much is on each plate.) I would almost initially dock a point for them not giving you more of that salsa, but once you master the burrito, you realize they give you the perfect amount as to not drown out all of the other excellent flavors. They throw a piece of meat on the grill  when your order it, cooked to your desire. None of that scoop-out-of-the-bin jargon. To be honest I haven't had any vegetarian here because when I think about Papalote, I smell that grill, get hungry and head over. Tall boys of PBR contribute to the 5 star rating as well. I don't usually wait long (I have not had a bad experience other than learning peak hours the hard way, but I've learned to get around that), but I am also not one of those people who shows up 10 deep at a place with like 4 tables and counter seating. You know who you are!
author: J W.
